Summary: Build complex, composable animations in MauiReactor using `AnimationController` with `SequenceAnimation`, `ParallelAnimation`, and tween/path animations.
Remarks: `AnimationController` is a `VisualNode` you place in your component tree to orchestrate animations via an internal timer you can Play, Pause, or Stop. It hosts a list of `Animation` nodes you compose into trees. Use `SequenceAnimation` to run child animations one-after-another; use `ParallelAnimation` to run them simultaneously. Tween animations like `DoubleAnimation` emit a numeric value from `StartValue` to `TargetValue` over `Duration`, optionally shaped by `Easing`. Path animations like `CubicBezierPathAnimation` and `QuadraticBezierPathAnimation` emit `Point` values along bezier curves (controlled via one or two control points). Compose multiple animations to drive UI properties on each `OnTick(...)` callback (e.g., position, opacity, scale). Keep durations and easings readable; prefer composable sequences for multi-step effects and parallel groups for combined motions. Manage controller lifecycle intentionally (start/stop on page appearing/disappearing) and avoid overly long or blocking operations inside `OnTick` to keep frames smooth.
Example:
// Example animation tree
new AnimationController
{
    new SequenceAnimation
    {
        new DoubleAnimation()
            .StartValue(0)
            .TargetValue(300)
            .Duration(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(2.5))
            .Easing(Easing.CubicOut)
            .OnTick(v => /* apply v to a property */),

        new DoubleAnimation()
            .StartValue(0)
            .TargetValue(300)
            .Duration(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(1.5))
            .OnTick(v => /* apply v */)
    },

    new ParallelAnimation
    {
        new CubicBezierPathAnimation()
            .StartPoint(new Point(0,100))
            .EndPoint(new Point(300,100))
            .ControlPoint1(new Point(0,0))
            .ControlPoint2(new Point(300,200))
            .OnTick(p => /* move element to p */),

        new QuadraticBezierPathAnimation()
            .StartPoint(new Point(300,100))
            .EndPoint(new Point(0,100))
            .ControlPoint(new Point(150,200))
            .OnTick(p => /* move element to p */)
    }
}
